intro: Reseda barrelieri var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-seeded reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elongated seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
